text: Wonderful little spot for coffee, food,and drinks. Friendly staff and good prices. Great coffee!

First day in Montreal, and the staff was super helpful. The guy with the stash is a G and gave me directions on how to get to where I needed to go. 
A more posh cafe, the place itself is pretty contemporary, and the drinks they serve there are good. The cold brew isn't too strong like some other places, and the food there is right on. 
Definitely would recommend this place if you want to study, chill, or relax with some friends.

Anywhere you can get a Labatt 50 or a homemade almond milk latte at the same location is a favourite in my books.

Super friendly staff.  Great place for a 5 à 7, to get some work done or grab a coffee on the go! 

Don't skip out on the Serrano and Iberico croissant - it's  delicious!
Vraiment les tapas les plus authentiques à Montréal. Magique. Je recommande en insistant.

It is a new cafe right across Arthur Nosh Bar, located in St-Henri and on Notre-Dame street. The interior decor of the café is really nice, with the lining of green plants next to the window and marble tables with little vases of flower, the counter is also really nice and neat. Cordova is a Spanish-style cafe and bar (when they will get their alcohol license), so they serve a variety of food that is inspired from Spanish cuisine or imported from Spain. We tried several exotic tapas style dishes, including Jamon Serrano, Chorizo Iberico Bellota, tomato bread, Hof Kelstein bread with parsley butter and soft boiled egg and anchovies. The Chorizo was the best of our choices, but the other ones are also very unique and flavourful. If you want to try some food out of the ordinary, come to Cordova and taste a few dishes of their menu, you will be happily surprised!

Et hop! Cinq étoiles! J'ai eu un moment poche la semaine dernière où je me suis dit: "I need a drink!". Je n'avais pas envie de me mettre sur mon 36 dans les circonstances, et je me suis sentie super à l'aise au Cordova. C'est juste assez cute pour que ce soit une gâterie d'y passer du temps et juste assez relax pour décompresser. La porte était ouverte, ça sentait l'été, il y avait des petites bougies sur les tables, le bonheur. Mon cocktail, que j'ai eu du mal à choisir à travers des options toutes tentantes, m'a plu par sa présentation, son goût (évidemment) et parce que franchement, il était bien alcoolisé. Disons que j'avais le rire facile en sortant. Ça tombait bien, puisque la facture nous a été remise avec un carton d'allumettes un peu coquin, que je vais photographier sans tarder et vous partager...
